website_summaries.verdict: A premium Intel processor that works great with Z97 boards.
pros: Equipped with Quick Sync video capabilities for streamlined video conversions
Designed for graphics-heavy applications like video editing and image rendering
Wonderful choice for those who prioritize overclocking
cons: Less durable than comparable Intel processors

customer_reviews.title: Best option if you have an 1150 Z97 board and ...
customer_reviews.text: Best option if you have an 1150 Z97 board and need to make your system last a little longer. Sure you could go with some of the newer processors, but you would need a new board and RAM and that means spending $600+ to get about the same performance this one can give you.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Best z97 processor. Maybe not worth it at this price if you're building new.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in October 2014 (4 months after launch) and it has been the best processor I have ever had. I am nowhere near thinking of upgrading and it runs better than some newer generation i7. Overclocks with no issue. Now, I only paid $309 in 2014 so I am not sure it would be worth buying this generation at this price in 2018, but if you have to because of compatibility, this is the best z97 processor you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for 4 years
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for 4 years. I'm about to upgrade to a 9000-series Intel CPU as I write this. The newer CPUs are only maybe 15% faster for 1-4 thread workloads, which makes this CPU all the more impressive. The only drawback I can think of is that Intel's overclocking software (on Windows) seems to cause instability, although regular overclocking through BIOS seemed OK. Definitely better than AMD, which is 95% marketing hype and 5% product.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Power house, plain and simple. If you already ...
customer_reviews.text: Power house, plain and simple. If you already have a socket 1150 motherboard and DDR3 DIMMs, there is not yet much point in upgrading to the i7-6700k or i7-7700k, as all 3 have roughly the same performance and the latter two would require a new motherboard and all new DDR4 DIMMs. If your 4790k doesn't overclock very well, learn why by Googling "silicon lottery", and look into swapping it with another somehow. They should overclock to ~4.5ghz with air cooling(use a tower cooler, not the stock cooler. Stock heatsink is small.)
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great processor & excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome upgrade! I recently built a new system around this CPU using the 4790k, the MSI Gaming 5 Motherboard, the Noctua NH-D14 CPU cooler, and the Coolermaster HAF 922 Case. The i7 is really fast and handles all of my games, video streaming, and video encoding without any problems. I was lucky enough to get this CPU right before Skylake came out, so I saved some money on getting a quality processor on last year's flagship processor. If you are looking to build a powerful computer but aren't ready for Skylake Devil's Canyon won't disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: socaljazzdude

customer_reviews.title: Very solid chip and easy to overclock...
customer_reviews.text: A rock solid processor that easily overclocks to 4.6 or even 4.8 with the correct cooling system. I am running at 4.6 with 1.25v, 32gigs DDR3 2400hz RAM, air cooling and the system is totally stable and runs fast as heck! Temps are mid 80'sC under stress test and mid 40'sC during normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Gruis

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed will not be the bottleneck
customer_reviews.text: Impressive speed. Use mine for video editing/compressing, gaming, everything. Never had this CPU bottleneck anything I've done. If this CPU becomes your bottleneck then my diagnosis is one of three things: 1) Your workload is intensive enough, in which case you most likely know a thing or two about PCs, and therefore should have known better. 2) You are doing stuff that is beyond the league of a common consumer CPU. 3) You are doing video compression (or similar) just like me and are going to see 100% cpu usage by design. 4) Run a virus scan, because you probably have a virus :) Can't go wrong with this one (for an older generation).
customer_reviews.author: Nate B

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from i5-4690k.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from i5-4690k. Didn't expect to see that much improvement, definitely worth the price for upgrade. Over clocked to 4.8 GHz with ease and noticeable improvement. System Specs i7-4790K @ 4.8Ghz ASUS Z97-A/USB 3.1 CPU Cooler Corsair H60 16GB (2x8GB) DDR3 1600 EVGA GeForce GTX 980 Ti SC 6GB x2 SLI Acer XB270HU 144Hz 27-inch 1440 EVGA SuperNOVA 1300 G2 80+ GOLD SSD - Crucial MX200 250GB - OS SSD - Samsung 850 EVO 1 TB - Games HDD - WD Blue 1TB - Backup & Videos OS: W 10 Pro
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a rockstar!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It laughs away gaming (I'm using a dedicated video card), eats photo editing for lunch, and churns through video rendering tasks like nobodies business. I won't feel the need to overclock this for a while. Oh, and the stock cooler does an alright job but that teeny tiny fan has to spin very fast and make a lot of noise. After two days of that I couldn't stand it anymore and went with a CM Hyper212 and Noctua fan. Keeps temps much cooler and the noise levels waaaay down.
customer_reviews.author: It's a me, Mario!

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU For the Enthusiastic gamer
customer_reviews.text: up to this point, the CPU is truly fast an is able to fulfill 60 fps on my gaming rig on my gtx980 with quality maxed out while recording with Fraps. i recommend getting a premium heat sink for this CPU because it is Overclockable and (unlocked) for better turbo-boosting (because its an I7) and quieter cooling. but it does come with a stock air heat sink. 3797 on Fire Strike Ultra/ Intel Core i7-4790K/ NVIDIA GeForce GTX 980 my processor in benchmarks returned this. Reported stock core clock 4,000 MHz Maximum turbo core clock 4,400 MHz Physical / logical processors 1 / 8 # of cores 4 Package LGA1150 TDP 88 W
customer_reviews.author: Q13E5

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure there are better cpus in the X99 platforms- but seriously
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review on my multi-media rig. I am a casual gamer, digital illustrator, typical web surfer, film buff, and novice game-streamer on Twitch. Granted, I invested money into my motherboard, fans, gpu, sound card, etc.- this cpu makes the most sense for price to performance. I built my own rig- and it is a beast. This cpu handles all I throw at it with grace. I'm sure there are better cpus in the X99 platforms- but seriously, look at how expensive the platform is and the gains are hardly noticeable to the average consumer. If you are a gamer, surfer, streamer, and average enthusiast- this is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: The Arteest

customer_reviews.title: Things may not be as they appear
customer_reviews.text: I gave one star because the processor was not in original packaging, had thumb prints on the processor and did not work.
customer_reviews.author: abel acosta

customer_reviews.title: Great processor
customer_reviews.text: I built a new performance desktop and used this processor. It has plenty of power so I didn't even bother to overclock it, just leaving it in turbo mode. I don't have a problem with it over heating either, so I think the prior Haswell heat problems might be fixed with the refresh. I have been amazed at the speed of it when decoding and encoding video. We use Amazon for most of our purchases and I update my reviews if anything changes with the products. I do this so other Amazon users can get a real feel for the life of the product. I am not associated with any company and all opinions are my very own.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: If you want the best gaming rig this is what you want
customer_reviews.text: This processor is a beast! Without getting one of Intel's extreme processors this processor is by far the fastest gaming processor money can buy. It pretty much comes pre-overclocked. If you are an overclocking enthusiast you might want to check if this is truly your bottleneck because I haven't found a way to bottleneck this processor yet that isn't simply a prime number generator. The only con with this processor is that you should check your motherboards compatibility as I have an MSI GD65 z87 and when upgraded from a i5 4670k my pc no longer could reboot (only turn off then turn back on independently.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Still the fastest CPU in the world, even with newer CPU's having been released.
customer_reviews.text: Fastest processor in the world. Don't let people trick you into believing newer processors are faster. Most applications are single-threaded, and even multi-threaded applications aren't all that multi-threaded. (And this is great at multi-threading...) Look up single-thread benchmarks. This is still at top, even as of 4/13/2016. Major difference in horribly s***ty Bethesda engine games. (Fallout 4, Elder Scrolls Online, or any CPU-bound PoS engine like SWTOR).
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Overclocks great, definitely enthusiast grade
customer_reviews.text: Always gets the job done whether it's rendering video or playing games, haven't found anything it can't handle yet. Overclocks great, definitely enthusiast grade. The stock CPU cooler that it comes with isn't that great. There are many other options that I'd highly recommend looking into. If you're going to spend $250+ on a CPU then it is worth making sure it is properly cooled. The Hyper 212 Evo, Noctua DH-N15, Corsair H100i, and Kraken X61 are popular options all with their own pros and cons. Lots of information available on all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, but runs hot
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from an AMD FX8320 and the difference in speed is very noticeable. Most applications run quicker and smoother than with my previous CPU. It is about twice the price of the AMD card so improvement is expected. Games run much smoother well. My only complaint is the chip runs hot under load. I'm using CM Hyper 212 on it and it runs close to 80C under moderate load. I've been getting thermal shutdowns when it gets a little hotter. I've reinstalled the Hyper 212 twice now thinking maybe the contacts weren't good between the CPU and the heatsink, and the temps haven't changed. This is going to force me to buy a liquid cooling solution.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: The top dog of LGA 1150.
customer_reviews.text: A must for any "Z" board. Have a few non 'K" too. Not really the latest and greatest now that 1151 has come into the picture. Still does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: PC Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Complete overkill at stock.
customer_reviews.text: Very very very fast. Upgraded from an i5 4570, which really is overkill already, and the difference is immediately noticeable in games and other CPU intensive tasks. The only problems I have are from some stupid registry entries that are ultimately my fault, so no stars subtracted. Oh yeah, excellent shipping as well. Ordered on a Saturday with prime 2 day shipping expecting to get it Monday or Tuesday. Was walking out of my apartment building to head to the corner store Sunday morning and tripped over the box lol. Couldn't believe it. First class Amazon. Keep it up.
customer_reviews.author: cothealiv

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome processor for someone that want's to build a monster ...
customer_reviews.text: Well the first time they sent this to me it was an empty box. Someone who packed the box apparently removed the processor. Thankfully, Amazon sent one out overnight to make up for the problem. After that fiasco I have been very impressed. I was torn to buy this processor or a hex core for gaming and I decided on the 4790k because most games won't utilize six cores and the added ability to overclock this more than the other processor sold me. Plus, it's cheaper so I could put the money I saved where it counts, the video card.This is an awesome processor for someone that want's to build a monster gaming machine.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: I'm gonna copy someone else here: "Finally a CPU that isn't scared to OverClock!"
customer_reviews.text: I'm sitting here, typing on the computer that I bought this for. I'm smiling my face off just thinking on all the pressure that i placed on this cpu for five days straight. It didn't even flinch. This cpu right here is why I love custom building computers. Powerful, slightly expensive, but worth it. OC'ing this was a breeze compared to others, and it stayed cool (about 60-70 Celsius) even with an air cooled system. (I'm gonna retest with a liquid coolant system and see how it works then)
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU. It had pci 16x only
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU. It had pci 16x only, so know it if you're planing to have two graphics card configuration. It will be fine, but any WiFi/sound card will need to use USB. I use it with Noctua DH-15 cooler. I turned off intel turbo boost and clocked it to run on 4.4GHz all the time. At idle it sits on 33-35C with ALL case/cooler fans OFF. When in game/benchmark it doesn't go higher that 50C with cooler fans on 45%. Overall it's great cpu, which doesn't heat up too much.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: LGA 1150 CPU
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the CPU & it works great. Very prompt delivery & was exactly as the seller said, not like the other one I had to return. This seller is very good & offers excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Chip! Does run hot without a good heat sink.
customer_reviews.text: I have this clocked at 4.7ghz at 1.25v running stable using the Noctua dh-14. I originally had my old hyper 212 evo with it... This card definitely runs hot. I don't recall exactly, but I do remember that some of my first overclocking attempts at 4.5 or 4.6 ghz with the evo ran it up to 95+C, which I then left decided to leave the default settings be. Paired with a good cooler, this card does have good potential, but if you're not going to spend $60+ on an aircooler to overclock it, you might want to look at a different cpu because this chip runs hot.
customer_reviews.author: Jon F.

customer_reviews.title: Old but really Good.
customer_reviews.text: I love this processor. I understand it can be overclocked but I am not planning on doing that at present. It has a video adapter built in to it so if you don't want to install a Vid Card you don't have to. Personally I have ordered an EVGA GTX 980 SC 4GB DDR5 Video Card. I have it installed on a Gigabyte Z97X Ultra Durable Black motherboard with 32GB of Vengeance OC 2400 ram. I have put together a fine unit and am proud of my new computer.
customer_reviews.author: Don Kandlbinder

customer_reviews.title: Screams and tears through games and editing.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this processor for almost a year and it still just chews up and spits out everything I throw at it. Games, video editing, OBS recording, you name it. Overclocks easily with a decent cooler. PC Specs: CPU: i7-4790k (4.4Ghz) Cooler: Noctua NH-D15 140mm (CPU under load doesn't go over 50C) RAM: 16GB Ballistix Sport DDR3-1600 GPU: ROG Strix GTX 1070 Case: Fractal Design Define R4 Window Storage: 1x PNY 120GB SSD and 1TB WD Caviar Blue
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Stupid fast
customer_reviews.text: This processor is absolutely fantastic. It runs so quickly that I haven't bothered overclocking it yet after several months. When it comes to gaming, video transcoding and rendering, or compiling code, it just flies. Now, be aware that for most tasks, and even most games, the 4790K is overkill. Most things most people do with their machines don't require 8 logical cores running at 4 GHz. But if you need or want this speed, this is a great CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: This CPU is FAST
customer_reviews.text: Item being reviewed Intel Core BX80646I74790K i7-4790K Processor (8M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz). Item was new in box and as advertised. All accessory parts were included. This CPU is FAST. Does great on latest games and it's more than enough (an over-kill actually) for what the non gaming average user would use it for. Heat is not an issue with proper case and cooling even with an air only cooling solution. Mine runs low to mid 30c in idle and 50-60c under prolonged load. It's capable of doing some good over-clocking but you may want to consider liquid cooling at that point if going that route.
customer_reviews.author: E M

customer_reviews.title: Verry happy
customer_reviews.text: Worked on first boot as expected. I recommend a bigger heat sink because inside the case gets super hot on the stock one. You can feel the heat if you put your hand a few inches away when the CPU is under load. It chews through everything easily but you need to keep it cool! I recommend something with good value like a CM Hyper 212 cooler. Installed on a Gigabyte GA-Z97X-SLI board and 16GB ram (Red CMY16GX3M2A2400C11R) and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Polarized

customer_reviews.title: Really fast cpu. overclockable.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice CPU. Can be overclocked, just be sure to use a liquid cpu cooler. Upgraded to the 6700k cpu on a new motherboard, and really can't tell a difference from the speed of the 4790k. I now feel upgrade was a waste of money, but sometimes ya gotta have the new🤷‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Still the performance king as of July 2016.
customer_reviews.text: The i7-4790K still out performs more recent iterations of the Core i7 line from Intel. If you want the performance king of Intel processors, this is still the one you want, even as of July 2016. That being said, you MUST get an aftermarket cooler for it whether you want to overclock or not. The processor itself is great, but Intel's stock cooling solutions are garbage and have been for some time. Personally I use the Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO, but I don't plan on doing any heavy overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: MrTechieMan

customer_reviews.title: 0 GHz base clock Great potential to overclock Runs cool under a watercooler Cons
customer_reviews.text: I've already written a review for this on Newegg so I'll keep it short. Pros: 4 cores with hyperthreading 8 MB cache 4.0 GHz base clock Great potential to overclock Runs cool under a watercooler Cons: Price, still $340 after almost 3 years? Slightly slower than Skylake Thoughts: I upgraded from a 4690k to stream and game simultaneously, I see little to no difference in gaming performance from my 4690k to my 4790k. So if you're only gaming don't waste money on an i7. Also, this chip needs way more voltage to reach 4.8GHz than my i5. The i5 only needed 1.26v, this needs 1.35v. I got lucky with my i5 on the silicon lottery.
customer_reviews.author: bhippler

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a good heatsink/fan combo with good thermal paste or just liquid ...
customer_reviews.text: Who can complain about this processor. Amazingly fast. Only thing I could see as a setback is the amount of heat it creates. Make sure you have a good heatsink/fan combo with good thermal paste or just liquid cool it. I use a Lepa 240 liquid cooler and it still gets pretty warm. I originally had a corsair single fan liquid cooler that kept my i5-4670 very cool but when swapped out for the i7-4790k I was seeing 80c under load so I decided an upgrade was in order.
customer_reviews.author: PAXpress

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: Oooooo buddy! This process is everything that I have heard and expected. I bought this processor for the fact that I stream on twitch and I needed something that was going to be able to run my games good, while also streaming. Well this processor is most definitely beafy enough for those tasks. Would suggest to anybody that is in the market for multi tasking major applications. I upgraded from the AMD fx 8350 and the performance is night and day really.
customer_reviews.author: Javin

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a little expensive and excessive, but great product nonetheless.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot complain at all. It arrived quickly from Amazon.com. The box was opened (seal torn) and slightly crushed but that is not Intel's fault. I think it happened during shipping and it was not tampered with. If I had it to do over again I probably would have bought the i5 and saved a few bucks. The 1080P video is smooth but I feel like I never really "max out" this CPU. I am using it for my Blue Iris setup and barely hit 7% CPU with 5 cameras. Oh well, at least I can say I have the latest and greatest, for now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Speedy, Stable Chipset
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to gauge a processor. For the most part, they tend to all work the same and provide similar speeds. Unless you're an enthusiast trying to eke out every meager megahertz you can, this is a perfectly fine processor for a gamer. In CPU-intensive MMO's like World of Warcraft I instantly jumped from 30 fps in the world to a straight 60 (and usually higher if I turn off v-sync). Computer boots super fast (mostly due to the SSD) and programs are responsive. Multi-threaded applications, including ones I design, work well. Overall a fine, stable chip.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Ayen

customer_reviews.title: Great Combo Client/Server Processor
customer_reviews.text: Very fast. Even combined with my PCIe SSD, it never reaches 100% utilization under normal use (aka, not bench-marking). I consistently run multiple Ubuntu-based game servers through Hyper-V, and play games on it simultaneously. When combined with SSD's and enough RAM, it makes a great combo client/server processor. I just run it at stock speeds. I feel no need to overclock it for my purposes. Maybe a few years down the road, as it ages, that will become a more important feature. The integrated graphics core is good enough to stream HD video, but I haven't tried much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 4970. Runs about 8 degree C warmer in a laptop which is to be expected. Chip works perfectly and came in good time. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Works great...excellent upgrade for my situation!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an Intel Core i5 processor (of the same generation) and the upgrade couldn't have been easier. Remove the old i5 chip and this one dropped right into place and was immediately recognized by the system on boot-up. This is used in my son's gaming PC and he is very happy with the improved performance.
customer_reviews.author: Brian-B

customer_reviews.title: Intel i7 Quad core 4.0GHz
customer_reviews.text: Built two systems with this CPU, W7 and W10. Both system s running very well on SSD system drives, 32GB RAM and Gigabyte MB. One CPU died, thanks to an electrician working on the furnace. INTEL replaced it under warranty, just have to follow their directions on the return. I purchased a replacement before I dealt with the warranty so there will be a third system in the future with this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Karl F

customer_reviews.title: Fast CPU
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this CPU. The computer I'm using this in is mostly for gaming and multimedia / home theater. My computer is nice and fast. I have no complaints about this CPU. I have been using it for about 9 months in my PC with a GTX 970 windforce GPU and crucial DDR3 memory.
customer_reviews.author: J. Qualls

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor, a little pricey considering that it's 3 generations old, but solid through and through.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing processor for a gen 4 i7. It out performs just about every other processor all the way up to the gen 6 i7's in it's class of quad cores. With a well rounded build you can run a music production studio suite while simultaneously gaming and/or performing other tasks that are considered "high-stress" for your system. If finding compatible motherboards wasn't an issue, and I were given the option between this processor and some of the newer gen 7's even, I would opt for this same 4790K processor in builds moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stock heatsync is garbage
customer_reviews.text: Stock heatsync was misaligned but I dont care because who uses the stock heat syncs anyway.....noobs thats who. Water cooling all the way :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Salfai

customer_reviews.title: Best processor on the market without needing DDR4 RAM.
customer_reviews.text: I am a game developer, so I needed some pretty good specs. This right here is the best processor you can get before you need a $250 mobo and DDR4 RAM. During the first whole day of me installing software, this did not even go above 35% usage. I have yet to have any complaints about this, and I am just running it at 4.2 GHz. My boot time with this is less than 15 seconds after I push the power button, and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jayden

customer_reviews.title: Great Chip - Updated
customer_reviews.text: Nice...Have mine over clocked to 4.6MHz and it runs stable and cool. Have had for 7 months now and did do some overclocking...Highest speed I got was 4.9 MHz. It did run warm withe watercooling at that speed but was stable and had no crashes. I now keep it at 4.7MHz as it runs cool (45 celsius) and everything is silent, cool and not over taxing. My 4790k is plugged into a Asus Z97 Pro with Wifi/AC and I couldn't be happier with the match. I can have a high performance setting, or just a quick speed that is stable and very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: ultra55371d

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding. No need to say much more.
customer_reviews.text: I can have do nearly everything shy of games and have my usage stay under 10%. This is a VERY fast processor that can handle multitasking and makes my new system worth every penny. You definitely want to build your system around a great processor, and this i7 is probably the best you can find for a gaming system right now.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: I am comming from a Core 2 Quad 6600 so its a nice little speed improvement
customer_reviews.text: Its fast, really fast. Software is always 2-3 years behind the hardware so I am hopeful that code will be updated to maximize the potential of this processor. I am comming from a Core 2 Quad 6600 so its a nice little speed improvement. Proof that processor does not make the gaming system, the GPU does.
customer_reviews.author: sr

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the stock cooler
customer_reviews.text: Very good unit, but whatever you do, get your own aftermarket cooler. I almost fried the paste onto this thing because it squished out from under the cooling plate, which by the way didn't cover the cpu even remotely, and was causing frequent restarts and crashed my hard drive more than once. they may work for the lower end stuff, but with an i7, they're just not going to cut it, and you may find yourself short a $300 unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amet DeCrypt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly the upgrade that I needed. I do some heavy gaming and this processor solved some FPS issues that I had been experiencing with the 8-CORE AMD processor that I used previously. The swap required that a compatible motherboard be installed. It went much more smoothly than I had anticipated. The entire system is running faster and glitch free with the i7-4790K installed.
customer_reviews.author: TheSeaDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome OC CPU
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after looking for an unlocked I7 to match with my Z87-A motherboard and NEPTON 240m water cooling. Work as expected, idle at 25-32 depending on your ambient temperature 21-23, mine was inside my office. Using ASUS suite OC utility, I was able to get this4.8ghz but settled for 4.6 for stable, not all my components can overclock well like my old 7970 RADEON card. Hopefully upgrading to Nvidia 980TI Hybrid I can push this further 4.8ghz.
customer_reviews.author: Rexxiboy

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU. The price of these guys have been ...
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU. The price of these guys have been excellent since they came out with the Skylake processors, which is great because I don't feel the need to jump to a Z170 platform just because it's new. The Z87s and Z97s still work excellent for those that are skeptical about buying an "old" CPU and motherboard. Currently, I sit 34 idle and about 50 while gaming with a H100i GTX.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Mehof

customer_reviews.title: I have used Intel CPUs since the first Core 2 Duo chips came out and have always been satisfied. I would love to get an AMD some
customer_reviews.text: Fast. Very fast. Noticeable upgrade from my old i3-2100. I don't do overclocking so I have no opinion in that regard. Paired with an AMD R9 290X and it eats everything alive that I throw at it. I have used Intel CPUs since the first Core 2 Duo chips came out and have always been satisfied. I would love to get an AMD some time but they just don't make processors that can be Intel for the type of build I was going for. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Logiquos

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, it's fast.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you can go wrong with this cpu. I built 2 systems with these and the speed is great. I'm not a gamer or a tweak nut looking for the last nanosecond of performance, but for my occasional graphics, video editing, programming/compiling and just multipurpose jacking around, this is the chip for me.
customer_reviews.author: F Volker

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Fast Processor... Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing processor. It is everything I hoped it would be. Extremely fast. Boots to Windows 7 Pro in 8 seconds. Great for overclocking. That is why I bought it. Hit 5.0Ghz with only having to up the voltage to 1.35v on a Asus Maximus VII Hero motherboard. Needs water cooled if you plan to overclock and push it. Using a EK EVO waterblock with a Swiftech H220 reservoir and pump to keep it cool. If you are thinking about buying this processor. Go for it! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Larry N. Covington

customer_reviews.title: No hardware issues, just speed after running it for over a month
customer_reviews.text: Runs great and combined with Cooler Master Hyper 212 Evo, I never have any issues with heat. Instructions are straight forward if you never built your own system before. Its pretty simple to match gold arrow marked corner with the one on the motherboard and careful set the chip in to avoid bending any pins.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the budget tech geek

customer_reviews.title: Best i7 for Price and One of the Best for OC
customer_reviews.text: Funnily enough this is still Intel's best mainline i7. The broadwell and skylake chips both don't overclock nearly as well (skylake has better performance per MHz, but that's easily made up by the Haswell Refresh's OC performance and lower price) Getting this to 4.8GHz is pretty damn easy if you have decent cooling, and if you managed a proper delid 5.0GHz is typically a cake walk. (bear in mind their's a chance you'll break your new $300+ cpu by doing this while also voiding the warranty if you try to delid)
customer_reviews.author: Comanglia

customer_reviews.title: Works great, smooth and cool
customer_reviews.text: Oh burns the games up! I placed this on a Gigabyte ATX DDR3 LGA 1150 SATA DIMM 6Gb/s Motherboard (GA-Z97X-UD3H), with 16 GB of ram, and it runs smooth and cool, even with the stock fan. Had it over a year now and haven't had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Everything on my computer runs really fast, and I got this thing to OC to five GHz. Yeah. While I've been waiting to get a graphics card, I've been playing World of Warcraft with onboard graphics. It sits from 45-60 FPS in medium to high settings with a populated screen. With Skype, YouTube, music, and a few other things running at the same time. I'm impressed, to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Works and is Fast
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to be able to stress this in the real world. I do a lot of photo editing, panoramas, and some video editing. With eight threads, have never seen system slow down even with video encoding and pano build working at same time! Needless to say I haven't tried overclocking yet, had planned on putting a slight overclock on it, but no need YET.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: mine died almost exactly 1 year after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just like 2 or 3 other 1 star reviews I read, mine died almost exactly 1 year after purchase. Everything working fine and woke up one morning and it was fried. Something is fishy about this.
customer_reviews.author: JollyJoel

customer_reviews.title: I decided to upgrade my 1150 from a 4590 while ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade my 1150 from a 4590 while waiting on the Optane technology to come out. What an upgrade! I had some stutter in games running 3440x1440p, now nothing. Overclocked to 4.4, 4.6 and 4.8 with air cooling in a ASUS Maximus Hero VI with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: 3 years, still going.
customer_reviews.text: Still working like a champ after 3 years! As long as this processor is alive, I won't be in need of another processor.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Shopper

customer_reviews.title: A very nice CPU
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This thing is fast. I'm running it at 4.6GHz, and it will do more if I can get it cooled off. The stock cooler is typically enough for i-series, but not for this one. It gets a little bit hotter than the earlier version because the voltage regulators are on the chip. Total power dissipation is 88W, and I've had mine to 53W so far, just loading one core, but if you were doing real time video you might want to monitor the temps closely, even at standard frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Allmon

customer_reviews.title: TRUST ME it is money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong in Nov 2017. It is a beast paired it with a Asus Sabertooth motherboard and two flash memory 8gig ram and a two terabyte hard drive ... TRUST ME it is money well spent
customer_reviews.author: kendall thom

customer_reviews.title: Nice and fast
customer_reviews.text: Installed it in a Hackintosh and worked great. Nice onboard 4600 graphics processor the ARCTIC Freezer i30 Extreme CPU Cooler keeps it nice an cool even under heavy 4K video editing. GeekBench scores single core=3946, multi core=16267
customer_reviews.author: Rockson Mars

customer_reviews.title: Great processor.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. There is not much to be said about the i7 other than it performs amazingly. It is currently being used in a decently high-end gaming rig and combined with a few other premium parts can run triple A games at ultra settings with no problem. Multitasking is a breeze as it can handle multiple programs running on two separate monitors with little to no problems.
customer_reviews.author: LordFirnen

customer_reviews.title: Good But Getting Dated.
customer_reviews.text: Runs my games at the best of FPS and great for premiere renders. It is getting dated in this age so I'd look at the 8700 series.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast
customer_reviews.text: This sucker is fast! I retired my old Core 2 Duo build and put this in my new setup. Wow, what a world of a difference! It's been a decade since my last overclocked PC so I'm excited to see how far I can push this beast. Intel has been on top of their game ever since they took the CPU crown away from the AMD Athlon series. This CPU is outstanding for any and every purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Overclocks like a mutha too
customer_reviews.text: I probably paid too much, but this is the final upgrade for my Haswell build and will keep me going for at least 2-3 years. The absolute fastest single thread performance if you're still on this socket. Overclocks like a mutha too!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: So far a great build for my needs
customer_reviews.text: put this in my ASUS Z97-DELUXE ATX DDR3 2600 LGA 1150 mobo and now have the graphics in the chipset for me gives me all kinds of room. having an integrated video and what appears to be a great picture gives me tons of room on the inside. Specs: Rosewell Legacy Case ASUS Z97-DELUXE ATX DDR3 2600 LGA 1150 Corsair 600 PSU Corsair Vengeance Pro Series 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR3 DRAM 2400MHz
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Very speedy chip that served as a nice drop-in replacement for an i5 in one of my ...
customer_reviews.text: Very speedy chip that served as a nice drop-in replacement for an i5 in one of my systems. It handles everything I throw at it with relative ease, and frankly it's hard to find any fault with it. I haven't overclocked it yet, but at 4.0GHz stock/4.4GHz turbo, I'm not exactly compelled to do so. That said, the stock cooler does run a bit noisy during high intensity workloads, so I'm planning to replace it with an aftermarket cooler soon.
customer_reviews.author: A. Eassa

customer_reviews.title: Insanely fast, overclockable, and stable
customer_reviews.text: I stream to Twitch and use this with a GTX 980 while streaming at 720P/60FPS. Overclocked to 4.6GHz while undervolting. Temps stay nice and cool with Noctua cooler, and CPU is extremely stable. This thing is a powerhouse. Used to have the 3570K and I would get stream stutter due to overworking the CPU. Same game, same streaming settings, doesn't even get close to 70% CPU usage. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MorningsideMims

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU, worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: It's a VERY good CPU. Upgraded from an FX 8350. I didn't want to go to the new DDR4 platform and spend an extra $100 or more....so this was a great choice. TONS more performance in rendering and gaming applications. Only gripe I had about it was the Amazon packaging...or lack thereof. There was literally NO packing material in the box to secure the CPU and keep it from being rocked around in the box. Luckily it seems there was no damage to the CPU itself.
customer_reviews.author: CydoneTV

customer_reviews.title: This processor flies!
customer_reviews.text: This processor blazes through any task that I throw at it. From word documents to re-encoding movies this CPU is unstoppable! I do not have it over clocked nor do I see a need for it in my case. I run this with 16GB of ram and am perfectly happy!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Previously a AMD user as well as a upcoming designer in interactive media, I needed to upgrade to something a lot more power. This was perfect for what I needed, possibly a bit overkill but that just means that I will be sticking with this for years. Its handling all my applications as well as games such as Planetside 2 perfectly which is a very cpu heavy game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for those on a budget and want highend gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU for anyone really. I have an old motherboard which is limited on choices, so it's a very good processor for anyone on a budget and wants to play AAA titles on high settings.
customer_reviews.author: Rami

customer_reviews.title: Hyperthreaded madness.
customer_reviews.text: Hyperthreaded madness. This baby is the center of my build and sits quite happily at 4.5GHz (with liquid cooling). It crushes video encoding procedures and makes multitasking a breeze. The onboard graphics are capable enough for me to avoid buying a graphics card, which is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby R.

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one I've purchased! Gamer's  dream CPU!
customer_reviews.text: Great for single processor applications,I.e, gaming! This thing will overclock to 4.5 with air cooling! And run stable. I have nothing bad to say about this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Buy for ANY Build!
customer_reviews.text: So much to like about this processor. I don't even know where to begin, it's THAT good. No matter what games I try, if I were to relate it to a champion athlete - I would say this little lady never breaks a sweat and doesn't even start breathing hard. She's sweet and likes to please, so what's not to like?!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfish

customer_reviews.title: Fast and solid
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation once you get over the fact the document is picture based with no written instructions. Use it along with your motherboard's instructions and make sure the steps match. That stupid plastic cover on the Mobo popped out when it wasn't supposed to. IT didn't break anything so all is good. Very nice processor. If you plan on overclocking, don't settle for the fan/heat sink that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M Miglio

customer_reviews.title: Intel>AMD
customer_reviews.text: This proccessor has been amazing so far I have had it for around 4-5 months now and have had no problem with overheating or not being able to handle what I do. I play alot of demanding games like Rust but not much video editing to the extreme. This CPU is definitely the best for the buck. I would recommend this to anyone that has a decent budget and or likes to game at an amazing level and likes great perfromance!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance, get a decent CPU cooler.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very power processor. I am consistently impressed with its performance. It does run hot, so I would get a good CPU cooler to keep it below 80c. At first I installed an H60, but under full load this CPU would be between 85-87c. I replaced the H60 with a Noctua DH-15, and now I have temps of between 75-78c under full load.
customer_reviews.author: flipmode

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my first ever computer build, and it definitely lived up to the hype. I hardly ever come close to using all of the power that this thing is capable of. Plays all of my games with no issues. Very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: NONE

customer_reviews.title: ... affordable and not obsolete 3 years later still runs like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and affordable and not obsolete 3 years later still runs like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Kay

customer_reviews.title: Mind Blowingly Fast
customer_reviews.text: Pretty incredible CPU, blows through absolutely everything and the overclocking potential is incredible (at least on my unit, this is subject to change due to the fabrication process). Was able to run 4.7GHz with only about 1.26 volts and kept this under 80C, so a great CPU for sure! Especially when it comes to CPU intensive games, this just eats through everything!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Have had not issues. Work great.
customer_reviews.text: have been using it pretty much non stop for the last 6 months. 12+ hours a day everyday. It has not over heated or caused any crashes. I am happy especially with the amount of use I use my computer. It is on pretty much from the time I get up till I go to bed. (even when I am not at it). Update: I have been using it now for over a year and no issues. Still running it the same too.
customer_reviews.author: Slbond

customer_reviews.title: 4790k is as good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: If you need an i7, 4790k is as good as it gets, at least before the 6xxx series came out! The 4790k reports 10% better single core performance, and performance per dollar is around 2.5x better. If you are using it for gaming, I highly recommend going for an i5 for the cost saving, as i7 does very little for gaming overall. Overall the 6700k is about 5-10% higher performance ignoring the single core, which is becoming less relevant as more applications utilize it.
customer_reviews.author: Stormcrown

customer_reviews.title: Forza Horizon 3 all run great and so does video processing
customer_reviews.text: There is no games yet this processor can't handle that I have found. Fallout, Beamng, Forza Horizon 3 all run great and so does video processing, moving files, etc. Great processor for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Relieable, very OverClockable
customer_reviews.text: I am running this daily OC'd 4.7ghz using a Corsair H100. Processer can easily hit 4.8 - 5ghz if you are using custom water cooling, but your not going to hit above 4.7 stable with any retail cooler and defiantly not with air, even the Noctua. Dollar for Dollar this is a great buy and a beast of a processor. If your not looking to spend more than $300 on a processor than this should be your one and only choice.
customer_reviews.author: Umyeps

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Simply one of the best CPUs on the market, both 6700k and this are both extremely close in comparison. Easily could buy this over the 6700k and you would notice no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Rdawg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome processor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install in my custom built by me computer. I installed it in a MSI Z97A Gaming 7 motherboard. I did not use the included fan, I opted for a Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO. I used Arctic Silver 5 thermal compound to mate the fan to the processor. All in all I was very happy with the purchase. Everything installed as it should with no problems. Super fast speeds.
customer_reviews.author: RoBroKnos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the all around desktop
customer_reviews.text: An impressive upgrade coming from AMD 8320. The score this chip gets is insane. Perfect for the all around desktop. High single core performance, which works wonders for those games that demand that. It's worth the cost if you want the performance. My only qualm with this chip is the temps bounce around like a jumping bean in an earthquake. Can go from 30c to 60c in a matter of seconds once I turn on prime95. But temps never go above 70 with a Hyper 212 EVO.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Helms

customer_reviews.title: Than You Intel for making such a Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This Processor is Unreal. Works FLAWLESS and Handles LOADS of data. Worth every Penny. Than You Intel for making such a Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Martly

customer_reviews.title: As Always, Great Processor.
customer_reviews.text: Intel has always knocked it out of the ballpark with their processors. Previous to this I had an i3 4170. Man, what an upgrade. Being a top of the line consumer processor, this thing will knock out any task you throw at it with ease. It's great for general use, rendering, gaming, and any other CPU intensive tasks. It does get a bit toasty though, so I would recommend picking up another cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. It includes a cooling fan that might not do great for overclocking but works fine for normal use. It has a little bit of thermal paste preloaded on the heatsink but doesn't look big enough to cover the whole CPU surface very well. I wiped their thermal paste off and used my own. It has a little Intel inside sticker as well for your computer case.
customer_reviews.author: Wraith7n

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Tested with Windows 7 pro and then with vmware 5.5. Works excellent. Tested for 4 days without urning off. Never hangup.
customer_reviews.author: csdgpr

customer_reviews.title: Great for number crunching
customer_reviews.text: This was near top of the line when I bought it. It's still blazing fast. I do lot's of CPU-intensive work, and this makes downtime much shorter. If you're looking for a CPU for a basic computer, look at the i3 variants instead.
customer_reviews.author: CGM

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC processor
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it'd be nice if some thermal paste was included (I mean, the stuff is like $3, include it!). But the processor itself, is amazing. I have mine overclocked (the BIOS makes this SUPER easy) to 4.2 and it stays around 45-50 degrees Celsius even while gaming, with just the stock cooler.
customer_reviews.author: DuncanPotatoes

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Have installed on a Gigabyte B85-HD3-A board with a Noctua cooler. Runs a little warm at 4.6 on one side during tests. But seems to handle what ever I throw at it without the hint of problem so I’m not to alarmed. Might just be signs of the age of my MB.
customer_reviews.author: BigAL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU. Have had it for a while and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Aregowe
